page.title: 16Water Supply
page.content: A good supply of water was always a major consideration when establishing a dwelling or a settlement.For example at Truscott we saw a pond which we think was used for water supply. Another water supply is the well.People in the old days had to take a bucket to the well to get their own water.At Langore for example people fetched their water from one of eight wells in the village.Langore was connected to mains water supply between 1958 and 1963.All other dwellings are on mains water supply but we saw old wells at Newmills, Hendragreen and Truscott.Sometimes we have water shortages and we have to use water wisely.The River Kensey never dries up completly though it has been known to flood surrounding farmland.Fishing is a popular passtime especially with some children.
